metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18009 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In OpenCV 3.3.1, a heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function cv::HdrDecoder::checkSignature in modules/imgcodecs/src/grfmt_hdr.cpp.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-contrib406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-core406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-dnn406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-features2d406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-flann406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-highgui406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-imgcodecs406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-imgproc406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-java - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-ml406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-objdetect406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-photo406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-shape406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-stitching406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-superres406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-video406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-videoio406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-videostab406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-viz406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv406-jni - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
opencv-data - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
python3-opencv - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3').
